options.label: D

title: The Eisenhower matrix: understanding task management

multiple-choice.question: What problem does a good time management strategy solve?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It has no effect on productivity and stress.

options.label: C
options.text: It increases your own productivity and reduces stress.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases stress but has no effect on productivity.

multiple-choice.question: Who developed the Eisenhower matrix?
What is the main purpose of the Eisenhower matrix?

options.label: A
options.text: To prioritize tasks by importance only

options.label: B
options.text: To prioritize tasks by urgency only

options.label: D
options.text: To prioritize tasks by urgency and importance

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the quadrant that includes tasks that are important and need to be done today or tomorrow?

options.text: A long-planned return to the gym

options.label: C
options.text: A task that can be eliminated

options.label: D
options.text: A review of an important document for your manager

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the quadrant that includes tasks that are less important but should be scheduled?
What is an example of a task that belongs to the "Schedule" sector?

options.label: A
options.text: A review of an important document for your manager

options.label: C
options.text: A task that can be eliminated

options.label: D
options.text: A long-planned return to the gym

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the quadrant that includes tasks that can be delegated?
What is an example of a task that belongs to the "Delegate" sector?

options.label: A
options.text: A review of an important document for your manager

options.label: B
options.text: A long-planned return to the gym

options.label: C
options.text: A task that can be eliminated

options.label: D
options.text: Someone calling you and asking for an urgent favor or requesting you step into a meeting

options.label: A
options.text: It is a story of a great warrior who united the region.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a story of a prophet who preached unity and respect for strangers.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a story of a king who ruled the region with an iron fist.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a story of a great leader who divided the region.

options.label: A
options.text: To promote tourism in the Middle East.

options.label: B
options.text: To create a new economy based on hospitality.

options.label: C
options.text: To promote peace and understanding among different cultures.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It will bring people together and promote peace and understanding.

options.text: Because their brains are less developed

title: Labor Day: Is it really a necessary holiday?

multiple-choice.question: What event led to the repeal of the anti-union law in Canada in 1872?

options.label: A
options.text: A national strike by Canadian laborers

options.label: B
options.text: A court ruling against the anti-union laws

options.label: D
options.text: Thousands of Ottawa laborers marching to Prime Minister John MacDonald's home

multiple-choice.question: Who was the American Union leader invited to Toronto's labor celebrations in 1882?

What was the main purpose of the Labor Day parade in New York City in 1882?

options.label: A
options.text: To celebrate the end of the summer

options.label: D
options.text: To rally for an eight-hour work day

multiple-choice.question: Which state became the first to legalize the Labor Day holiday in 1887?
What event led to President Grover Cleveland making Labor Day a federal holiday in 1894?

options.text: The Ottawa laborers marching to Prime Minister John MacDonald's home

options.label: B
options.text: The Central Labor Union moving the parade to the first Monday in September

options.label: C
options.text: The Toronto labor officials inviting an American Union leader to Toronto's labor celebrations

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: The strikers were successful in their demands

options.label: C
options.text: Violence erupted and two strikers were killed

options.label: D
options.text: The strike was called off due to bad weather

options.label: A
options.text: To celebrate the end of the summer

options.label: D
options.text: To rally workers for safer conditions, fair pay, and benefits

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.text: It was outsourced to other countries

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It is a day for leisure and enjoyment

options.label: D
options.text: It is a day for protesting wage cuts

title: Who won the space race? - Jeff Steers

multiple-choice.question: What was the name of the world's first man-made satellite, launched by the Soviet Union on October 4, 1957?
Which country's technology was used to launch the first piece of human technology into space during World War II?
What was the name of the rocket used by the Soviet Union to launch Sputnik into space, which had previously been tested for intercontinental ballistic missile capabilities?
What was the name of the U.S. satellite that failed to launch on December 6, 1957, after a live broadcast?
Who became the first human in space in April 1961, aboard the Soviet spacecraft Vostok 1?
In what year did the U.S. successfully launch John Glenn into orbit, making him the first American in space?
What was the U.S. program that successfully landed a man on the moon in 1969, as part of President Kennedy's goal to put a man on the moon by the end of the 1960s?
Who was the first person to walk on the moon during the Apollo 11 mission in 1969?
What was the name of the joint mission between the U.S. and the Soviet Union in 1975, which marked the end of the space race and the beginning of a new era of cooperation in space exploration?
What were some of the benefits of the space program, beyond the achievement of putting a man on the moon?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased funding for education and research, development of new technologies, and improved GPS and mobile phone signals

options.label: B
options.text: Improved international relations and increased military capabilities

options.label: C
options.text: Increased funding for space exploration and development of new space technologies

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased funding for education and research, and reduced development of new technologies

title: RNAi: Slicing, dicing and serving your cells - Alex Dainis

multiple-choice.question: What component of a cell translates the recipe from DNA into a protein?
What is the primary function of the RNA Silencing Complex (RISC) in the cell?

options.label: B
options.text: To chop up long, double-stranded RNA molecules

options.label: C
options.text: To target and destroy matching mRNA

multiple-choice.question: What is the process called when a cell uses RNA to knock down its own genes, preventing the production of a protein?
What enzyme is responsible for chopping up long, double-stranded RNA molecules in the cell?
What is the purpose of introducing an RNAi construct into a cell or organism?

options.label: C
options.text: To understand the function of a gene

options.label: D
options.text: To target and destroy specific genes

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the RISC complex targeting and destroying matching mRNA in the cell?

options.label: B
options.text: The creation of new DNA molecules

options.label: C
options.text: The translation of mRNA into protein

options.label: D
options.text: The chopping up of long, double-stranded RNA molecules

multiple-choice.question: What protein is responsible for stripping short snippets of double-stranded RNA in half in the RISC complex?
What phenomenon was observed in petunias when a pigment-producing gene was introduced, resulting in white patches and no pigment?
What is the potential advantage of using RNAi to target a specific system in an organism?

options.label: C
options.text: To understand the function of a gene

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential therapeutic application of RNAi in medicine?

options.label: C
options.text: To target tumor cells and cancer-causing genes

title: The good news of the decade? - Hans Rosling

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Poverty, Education, Gender, Health, and Environment

options.label: D
options.text: Poverty, Education, Health, Environment, and Global Links

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why the author likes the Millennium Development Goals?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are easy to achieve

options.label: B
options.text: Death certificates from doctors and specialists

options.label: B
options.text: A curve that continues beyond the last point

options.label: C
options.text: A line that only shows the data from 1977 to 2002

options.label: D
options.text: A line that uses advanced mathematical formulas to produce a trend line

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is too short a period

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is an average of two periods

options.label: C
options.text: Because it does not account for long-term investments

options.label: D
options.text: Because it does not account for economic growth

options.label: A
options.text: There is no relation between the two

options.label: B
options.text: Child mortality increases with family size

options.label: C

title: Mysteries of vernacular: Zero - Jessica Oreck and Rachael Teel

multiple-choice.question: What is the approximate age of the earliest known archaeological evidence of counting?
In which region did the first written number system begin to take form around 2500 B.C.?
What symbol did Indian mathematicians use in the seventh century to distinguish between numbers?
What is the literal translation of the Arabic word safira, from which the word zero originates?
What was the original meaning of the word cipher in English?

options.label: D
options.text: A concept representing absence or nothing

multiple-choice.question: In which language did the word zero come into English in the seventeenth century, initially as zefiro?
What is the origin of the word cipher in English, which later came to mean a code or secret message?
What is the modern meaning of the word cipher?
What is the relationship between the words zero and cipher, which share a common origin?
What does the word zero represent, as the absence of units or nothing?

options.label: C
options.text: The absence of units or nothing

multiple-choice.question: What is the earliest known archaeological evidence of counting, and how old is it?

options.label: A
options.text: A series of notches in bone, approximately 30,000 years old

options.label: B
options.text: A series of notches in bone, approximately 35,000 years old

options.label: C
options.text: A series of notches in bone, approximately 37,000 years old

options.label: D
options.text: A series of notches in bone, approximately 40,000 years old

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary function of the single dot used by Indian mathematicians in the seventh century?
What is the modern symbol for zero, and how did it evolve from the single dot used by Indian mathematicians?

options.label: A
options.text: A circle, which evolved from a single dot

options.label: B
options.text: A single dot, which evolved into a modern symbol

options.label: C
options.text: A triangle, which evolved from a single dot

options.label: D
options.text: A square, which evolved from a single dot

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the words zero and cipher, which share a common origin?
What is the modern meaning of the word cipher, and how did it evolve from its original meaning?

options.label: A
options.text: A code or secret message, which evolved from a concept representing absence or nothing

options.label: B
options.text: A number, which evolved from a concept representing absence or nothing

options.label: C
options.text: A symbol, which evolved from a concept representing absence or nothing

options.label: D
options.text: A letter, which evolved from a concept representing absence or nothing

title: From outer space to under our skin: a look at the universe

multiple-choice.question: How often do we look at the scene from a farther distance in the beginning of the journey?
What is the distance a man can run in 10 seconds, when the picture is 100 meters wide?
What is the distance a supersonic airplane can travel in 10 seconds, when the picture is 10 kilometers wide?
What is the distance an orbiting satellite covers in 10 seconds, when the picture is 10^6 meters wide?
What is the total number of powers of 10 that the field is reduced by, during the journey from the picnic on the lakefront to the atomic scale?
What is the size of the carbon nucleus, in terms of protons and neutrons?
What is the size of the atomic scale, in terms of meters?
What is the size of the angstrom, in terms of meters?
What is the size of the carbon nucleus, in terms of the number of quarks?
How many galaxies are in the Virgo cluster of galaxies?

title: How big is the biggest star?

multiple-choice.question: What is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy, producing glucose and oxygen?
Which of the following is an example of a renewable energy source that harnesses the power of the sun?
What is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and stormy atmosphere?
Which scientist is credited with the discovery of gravity and its universal law of attraction?
What is the term for the movement of tectonic plates that results in the creation of mountains, such as the Himalayas?
Which of the following is an example of a chemical reaction, such as combustion or acid-base neutralization?

options.label: D
options.text: A mixture of elements undergoing a chemical change

multiple-choice.question: What is the process by which water moves through a plant, from the roots to the leaves, and is released into the air as water vapor?
Which scientist is credited with the discovery of the theory of evolution through natural selection, which explains the diversity of life on Earth?
What is the term for the study of the origin, evolution, and fate of the universe, including the Big Bang theory?
Which of the following is an example of a type of rock that is formed from the cooling and solidification of magma, such as granite or basalt?

title: The science of macaroni salad: What's in a mixture? - Josh Kurz

multiple-choice.question: What is a mixture in the context of combining different ingredients?

options.label: A
options.text: A chemical reaction that changes the properties of the ingredients

options.label: B
options.text: A combination of two or more things together without changing their chemical identity

options.label: C
options.text: A solution where particles are dissolved in another substance

options.label: D
options.text: A suspension where particles are floating in another substance

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a mixture that is made up of two or more mixtures?
What is the main difference between a suspension and a solution?

options.label: A
options.text: The size of the particles in the mixture

options.label: B
options.text: The type of ingredients used in the mixture

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a solution where the particles are dissolved in another substance?
What is an example of a colloid?

options.label: A
options.text: A mixture where particles are suspended in another substance

options.label: B
options.text: A solution where particles are dissolved in another substance

options.label: C
options.text: A mixture where particles are too small to separate

options.label: D
options.text: A suspension where particles are floating in another substance

multiple-choice.question: What is an emulsifier in the context of making a colloid?

options.label: A
options.text: A substance that helps to break down particles

options.label: B
options.text: A substance that helps to bind particles together

options.label: C
options.text: A substance that helps to dissolve particles

options.label: D
options.text: A substance that helps to separate particles

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a mixture and a chemical reaction?

options.label: A
options.text: The type of ingredients used in the mixture

options.label: B
options.text: The size of the particles in the mixture

options.label: C
options.text: Whether the properties of the ingredients change

multiple-choice.question: What are examples of complex organic molecules?
What is the final stage of breaking down a mixture or substance?

options.label: C
options.text: Breaking down the particles into their simplest form

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of breaking chemical bonds in a substance?

options.label: A
options.text: To change the properties of the substance

options.label: C
options.text: To break down the substance into its simplest form

options.label: D
options.text: To mix the substance with another substance

multiple-choice.question: What is the term for a mixture where particles are floating in another substance?
What is an example of a colloid that is often used as a topping for food?
What is the purpose of lecithin in the production of mayonnaise?
What is the main difference between a mixture and a compound?

options.label: A
options.text: The type of ingredients used in the mixture

options.label: B
options.text: The size of the particles in the mixture

options.label: C
options.text: Whether the properties of the ingredients change

options.label: D
options.text: Whether the ingredients are chemically bonded

multiple-choice.question: What are examples of complex organic molecules that are found in living organisms?
What is a type of mixture where particles are suspended in another substance?
What is the term for breaking down a substance into its simplest form?

options.label: D
options.text: Mixing a substance with another substance

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of separating particles chemically?

options.label: A
options.text: To change the properties of the substance

options.label: C
options.text: To break down the substance into its simplest form

options.label: D
options.text: To mix the substance with another substance

What is the term for a substance that is made up of two or more elements chemically bonded together?
